intro: Gynoxys ilicifolia, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often medicinal properties. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a leathery texture and a slightly serrated edge. Gynoxys ilicifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
